conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with block P sliding on board ab, which is stationary.
Identifying the coefficients of kinetic friction: μ1 between board and ground, μ2 between block and board.
Recognizing the question asks for the frictional force exerted by the ground on the board.
Block P moves with velocity v, implying frictional forces between block and board, and board and ground.
Frictional force on P is μ2 * m * g, opposing its motion.
Board ab experiences a frictional force to the right due to P.
Board remains stationary, so net force on it must be zero.
Frictional force from P on board is balanced by frictional force from ground on board.
Frictional force between P and board is μ2 * m * g.
Frictional force between board and ground is equal in magnitude to frictional force between P and board.
Considering static friction between board and ground because board is stationary.
Static friction equals the force trying to move the board, which is frictional force between P and board.
Magnitude of frictional force exerted by ground on board is μ2 * m * g.
Confusion between static and kinetic friction; static friction is relevant here.
